intro: Eremogone calcicola, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Linaceae family and is adapted to thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. Eremogone calcicola is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an indicator species for dry, rocky habitats.
